analyzed: gang bdag gis thos pa de ni 'di skad yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: “ Thus have I heard” means “what I have heard is just this, not something else.”

analyzed: 'dis ni phri ba dang bskyed pa spang ba'i phyir thos pa yang dag pa nyid du dam 'cha'o //

original: des ni lan cig thos nas len cing 'dzin pa yang dag par rab tu ston par byed par brjod do //
analyzed: des ni lan cig thos nas len cing 'dzin pa yang dag par rab tu ston par byed par brjod do //
translated: “ At one time” also indicates that the compiler heard the teaching in its entirety, not just a part of it.

translated: “ The Bhagavān” indicates the teacher of the teaching.

original: sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas shing yang dag par zhus pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa spyad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas shing yang dag par zhus pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa spyad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they have served the Buddhas, have asked the right questions, and have practiced generosity, morality, and so on.

original: gzhan du na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi gtso bo nyan pa la sogs pa mi srid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi gtso bo nyan pa la sogs pa mi srid do //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible for them to listen to the principal meaning of the perfection of wisdom as it is explained here.

original: de skad du mgon po byams pas /
analyzed: de skad du mgon po byams pas /
translated: The Lord Maitreya has said this:

original: sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par byas //
translated: They have served the Buddhas well,

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed //

original: 'di nyan pa yi snod du 'gyur //

original: sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur mang dag zhus //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur mang dag zhus //

analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyad pas // len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //

original: snod nyid du ni mkhas pas shes //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snod nyid du ni mkhas pas shes // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The wise know that they are fit🔽to receive, hold, and so on.

original: de dag kyang gdul bya rnams kyi dang ba dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / gus pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang gdul bya rnams kyi dang ba dang / mi g-yeng ba dang / gus pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this is in order to generate faith, nondistraction, respect, and so on in the disciples.

original: bdag gi zhes 'byung @268a * //
analyzed: bdag gi zhes 'byung @268a * //
translated: The phrase my self is used.

analyzed: ba rnam par dbye ba gsum pas ni yi ge'i sgra ji lta ba bzhin thos pa nyid ston te /
translated: The phrase by me is the third analysis, which shows that the word heard is to be taken literally.

analyzed: de na thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa yin pas rang gi rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yongs su spong ngo //
translated: Since it is knowledge that arises from hearing, it excludes the nature of personal realization.

original: de lta ma yin na ni bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par dbye ba drug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba rnam par dbye ba drug par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the phrase heard by me would be the sixth analysis,

original: shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have the meaning of knowledge.

original: da ni thos pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thos pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the nature of hearing,

analyzed: dus gcig na zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa skabs rtsom par byed de /
translated: the passage begins with the words at one time.

original: dus ni ston la sogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ni ston la sogs pa'i dus so //
translated: Time refers to the time of autumn, etc.

original: gcig na zhes 'byung ba 'dis ni dus zhes 'byung ba 'di bye brag tu byed do //
analyzed: gcig na zhes 'byung ba 'dis ni dus zhes 'byung ba 'di bye brag tu byed do //
translated: At one time specifies the word time.

original: de yang bzhugs te zhes 'byung ba de nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang bzhugs te zhes 'byung ba de nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: He was dwelling is connected to that.

original: bdud bzhi bcom par gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom par gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Bhagavān means the Blessed One, because he has conquered the four māras.

original: yon tan dang phrin las mtha' yas shing mchog tu gyur pa 'gro ba'i bla ma mdzad pa dang / yon tan gyi sgo nas mtshan mtha' yas pa zhig mngar zin kyang /
analyzed: yon tan dang phrin las mtha' yas shing mchog tu gyur pa 'gro ba'i bla ma mdzad pa dang / yon tan gyi sgo nas mtshan mtha' yas pa zhig mngar zin kyang /
translated: Although he has an infinite number of names according to his qualities,

original: 'on kyang 'khor theg pa gsum pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa rnams kyis cig car skyabs su 'os pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor theg pa gsum pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa rnams kyis cig car skyabs su 'os pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: nevertheless, in order to show that he is worthy of being the refuge of all beings, who are engaged in their own and others' goals, and who follow the three vehicles,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'jigs pa'i rgyu tshar gcod par byed pa nyid du ston to //
translated: he is called Bhagavat, because he has destroyed all the causes of fear.

original: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig tu brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyi tshig tu brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in all the sections of the teaching, he is called Bhagavat.

original: rgyal po'i khab ces 'byung ba ni yul ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ces 'byung ba ni yul ma ga dh'a'i grong khyer gyi bye brag go //
translated: Rajagriha is the name of a town in the country of Magadha.

original: de'i phyogs gcig na bya rgod phung po zhes bya ba'i ri rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs gnas yod de de na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig na bya rgod phung po zhes bya ba'i ri rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs gnas yod de de na bzhugs so //
translated: On one side of it, on the Vulture Peak Mountain, which is always the dwelling place of the Buddhas, he resides.

original: bya rgod phung po'i ri ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pas mchod rten nyid du gyur pa dang me la sogs pa'i 'jig pa rnams kyis kyang gzhig tu med pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bya rgod phung po'i ri ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pas mchod rten nyid du gyur pa dang me la sogs pa'i 'jig pa rnams kyis kyang gzhig tu med pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The Vulture Peak is a stupa because the Bhagavan abides there and it should be understood that it cannot be destroyed by fire and so on,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated in the Bodhisattva Canon that it is so.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma la sogs pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma la sogs pa las kyang /

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs 'di nyid du //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs 'di nyid du //
translated: In this very eastern direction of Rājagṛha

original: sangs rgyas bye ba stong rnams mthong gyur cing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba stong rnams mthong gyur cing //
translated: one will see ten thousand buddhas

original: rgyal ba kun gyi drung du 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rgyal ba kun gyi drung du 'di yis ni //
translated: and in the presence of all those victors

original: ting 'dzin zhi ba mchog 'di zhu ba byas //
analyzed: ting 'dzin zhi ba mchog 'di zhu ba byas //
translated: one will request this supreme peaceful samādhi.

original: zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is consistent with the statement.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa spyod lam bzhi gang yang rung bas bzhugs pa'i phyogs /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa spyod lam bzhi gang yang rung bas bzhugs pa'i phyogs /
translated: The Tathāgata is liberated from all faults such as investigation and analysis. In whatever direction he abides in any of the four modes of conduct,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis byung ba 'jig pa @268b rnams kyis 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the destruction of the world occur through the power of the Tathagata?

original: lha dang 'phags pa dang tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa dam pa bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bzhugs pa gsum po de dag gis bzhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: lha dang 'phags pa dang tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa dam pa bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bzhugs pa gsum po de dag gis bzhugs par gyur te /
translated: The three abodes are the abode of the gods, the abode of the noble ones, and the abode of Brahma. The abode of the gods is the fourth meditation, which is the best abode. The abode of the noble ones is the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. The abode of Brahma is great compassion.

original: de'i sgra ni bzhugs zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i sgra ni bzhugs zin pa'i don to //
translated: The root text states that the Buddha “dwelt” in these three abodes.

original: de na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa'i dus na 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa ni chos yang dag par sdud pa'i dus na 'das pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha dwelt in the abode of the gods when he compiled the Dharma Flower Sutra.

original: dus gcig na zhes 'byung ba'i bye brag gis ni thugs rje chen po la gzhol ba 'gro ba'i bla ma dus gzhan na ni yul gzhan na bzhugs par ston to //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes 'byung ba'i bye brag gis ni thugs rje chen po la gzhol ba 'gro ba'i bla ma dus gzhan na ni yul gzhan na bzhugs par ston to //
translated: The phrase “at one time” indicates that the Buddha, the teacher of the world, who is devoted to great compassion, was dwelling in another place at another time.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa gzhan rnams kyis kyang dam pa gsum gyis gnas par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa gzhan rnams kyis kyang dam pa gsum gyis gnas par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, those who follow the Buddha should also dwell in these three abodes.

original: byed pa gang yang rung ba dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa gang yang rung ba dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not by any other kind of person.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa ni nyan par gtogs pa 'dus par ston te //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa ni nyan par gtogs pa 'dus par ston te //
translated: With a great community of monks, etc. shows the assembly of listeners.

original: de la nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
translated: There, they are monks because they have destroyed the afflictions.

original: de dag mang po tshogs pas dbyer med pa'i phyir dge 'dun no //
analyzed: de dag mang po tshogs pas dbyer med pa'i phyir dge 'dun no //
translated: They are a community because they are a multitude, and because they are not divided.

original: chen po zhes 'byung ba ni phal che ba nyid kyis sam /
analyzed: chen po zhes 'byung ba ni phal che ba nyid kyis sam /
translated: Great means that they are many,

original: shes rab dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas so //
analyzed: shes rab dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas so //
translated: or that they are endowed with wisdom, miracles, etc.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun chen po dang yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun chen po dang yang ste /
translated: With a great community of bodhisattvas, great spiritual heroes.

original: 'di la yang che ba nyid gsum gyis ston to /
analyzed: 'di la yang che ba nyid gsum gyis ston to /
translated: Here also, greatness is shown to be threefold.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid dang / spong ba che ba nyid dang / rtogs pa che ba nyid kyis so //🔽de dag dang thabs cig ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid dang / spong ba che ba nyid dang / rtogs pa che ba nyid kyis so // de dag dang thabs cig ste /
translated: They are the best of all beings, with great minds, great renunciation, and great understanding.🔽They are together with them,

original: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan cig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that they are together with them.

original: bzhugs pa'i bya ba la lhan cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dan gyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i bya ba la lhan cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dan gyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third is the characteristic of simultaneity, since the action of existing is simultaneous with the existent.

original: gtogs pa 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'di la gtogs pa su yin zhe na /
analyzed: gtogs pa 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'di la gtogs pa su yin zhe na /
translated: What is included?

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan pa la sogs par snang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa yongs su smin pa ni gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan pa la sogs par snang ba 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon bskyed pa yongs su smin pa ni gtogs pa yin te /
translated: The included are the roots of virtue previously generated that have matured and are capable of producing the appearance of listening to the Dharma and so on.

original: chos nyan pa la sogs pa la skal pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: chos nyan pa la sogs pa la skal pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: They are included because they are the fortune for listening to the Dharma and so on.

original: / rang mtshan mar grub par bya ba'i phyir yul dang dus dang // 'khor dbang du byed cing dbang dang bcas par smras na /
analyzed: / rang mtshan mar grub par bya ba'i phyir yul dang dus dang // 'khor dbang du byed cing dbang dang bcas par smras na /
translated: If one controls the place, time and retinue in order to establish the characteristics of the speaker, and if one speaks with power,🔽one will be understood to be a valid speaker.

original: smra ba po tshad ma yin par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes che ba gang dag smra ba de ni bdag gis khong du ma chud de /
analyzed: smra ba po tshad ma yin par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes che ba gang dag smra ba de ni bdag gis khong du ma chud de /
translated: I do not understand this greatness that is said to be the greatness of the speaker.

original: 'di ltar yul de dag tu song zhing dpang rnams la 'dri na ni de @269a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul de dag tu song zhing dpang rnams la 'dri na ni de @269a * //
translated: If one were to go to those places and ask the witnesses,

analyzed: nus pa med pa rnams kyis mdo'i don gtan la dbab pa thag ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those who are not capable would be far from determining the meaning of the sūtra.

analyzed: yang ji ltar mdo sde 'di bzhin du gang du 'khor gyi ming ma bstan pa de ji ltar dbang zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Moreover, just as this sūtra, so too in those sūtras where the name of the retinue is not taught, how should one understand the word “retinue”?

original: 'og ma yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'og ma yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar bstan la /
translated: The retinue of bhikṣus is taught first because it is lower.

original: gong ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis bstan to //
analyzed: gong ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis bstan to //
translated: The retinue of bodhisattvas is taught later because it is higher.

original: ji ltar gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'gro ba rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang rgyal ba rnams kyi bsod nams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /🔽kha cig tu ni 'og ma nas go rims bzhin du bkod do //
analyzed: ji ltar gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'gro ba rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang rgyal ba rnams kyi bsod nams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste / kha cig tu ni 'og ma nas go rims bzhin du bkod do //
translated: Just as in the sūtra it says, “Whatever merit there is of the beings in the ten directions, of the learners, of the nonlearners, and of the pratyekabuddhas,”🔽in some places the order is arranged from lower to higher.

original: kha cig tu ni gong ma nas go rims bzhin du bkod de /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gong ma nas go rims bzhin du bkod de /
translated: In some places the order is arranged from higher to lower.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the so-called Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan dag ni 'khor rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'khor rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar smos so //
translated: Others say that the assembly of monks is mentioned first because it is a permanent retinue.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis smos so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis smos so zhes pa'o //
translated: The assembly of Bodhisattvas is mentioned later because it is not permanent.

original: rtag pa ni sngar brjod par bya ba yin la de las gzhan ni phyis yin no zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni sngar brjod par bya ba yin la de las gzhan ni phyis yin no zhes bya ba de ni rigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable, because it is said that the permanent should be mentioned first, and that which is different from that later.

original: gleng gzhi gang gis bstan pa 'di 'jug pa'i gleng gzhi de bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gleng gzhi gang gis bstan pa 'di 'jug pa'i gleng gzhi de bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the nidāna by which this teaching is introduced,

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “at that time,” and so on.

original: 'khor rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'khor rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: The teaching of the ripening of the roots of virtue of the retinue is at that time.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mdzad pa'i dus de yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par mdzad pa'i dus de yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe zhes bya ste /
translated: That is the time when the Blessed One enters into meditative concentration.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dus mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dus mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One knows the time.

original: chos ni phung po la sogs pa yin te rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: chos ni phung po la sogs pa yin te rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Dharma is the aggregates, etc. , which are held to be the bearers of their own characteristics.

original: yongs su kun du thams cad du 'di la 'ang 'dis khong du chud rtogs rig pas na chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su kun du thams cad du 'di la 'ang 'dis khong du chud rtogs rig pas na chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a “dharma-discourse” because it is understood, realized, and known by this one in all ways, in every way, in every respect.

original: zab mo ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The profound is emptiness, etc.

original: gang du'ang gang gis snang ba go rims bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la ltos pa de ni zab mo snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang du'ang gang gis snang ba go rims bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la ltos pa de ni zab mo snang ba yin no //
translated: The appearance of the profound is that which is dependent on one’s own and another’s continuum, respectively.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: The profound is emptiness, etc.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs mtha' //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs mtha' //
translated: The extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial

original: bral ba de ni zab mo nyid //🔽ces bstan te /
analyzed: bral ba de ni zab mo nyid // ces bstan te /
translated: are free from the profound.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba yang yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba yang yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The extreme of superimposition and the extreme of denial are free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: de bas na slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /🔽gang blo yod dang med pa las //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas / gang blo yod dang med pa las //
translated: Therefore, the master Nāgārjuna says:🔽The mind that transcends existence and nonexistence

original: rnam par 'das shing mi gnas pa //
analyzed: rnam par 'das shing mi gnas pa //
translated: and does not abide is the supreme.

original: de dag zab mo @269b dmigs med pa'i //
analyzed: de dag zab mo @269b dmigs med pa'i //
translated: They meditate on the meaning of the condition

original: rkyen gyi don las rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: rkyen gyi don las rnam par bsgom //
translated: of the profound, which is free from reference points.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Samādhi has the characteristic of the one-pointedness of mind.

original: yang dag par 'jog pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du bzhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: To abide in that nature for the sake of perfect placement is to enter into meditative equipoise.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdzad pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi don gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdzad pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi don gtso bo yin no //
translated: In this way, the primary purpose of all the activities of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is the welfare of others.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par zhugs pa ni 'khor thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyi don bstan pa dang mthun pa ji ltar rang rang gi rgyud yongs su smin par rung ba skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par zhugs pa ni 'khor thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud ting nge 'dzin gyi don bstan pa dang mthun pa ji ltar rang rang gi rgyud yongs su smin par rung ba skyes pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, when the Blessed One enters into this samādhi, the mind-streams of all the retinue are in accord with the meaning of the samādhi that is taught, and they give rise to the suitability of their own mind-streams being fully ripened.

original: de ni de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood in that way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyon mongs pa med par mkhyen pa yang 'dir khungs su gzhag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyon mongs pa med par mkhyen pa yang 'dir khungs su gzhag ste /
translated: The Blessed One’s knowledge of the absence of afflictions should also be presented here as a source.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni bdag mthong na mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni bdag mthong na mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su spong ngo //
translated: The śrāvakas’ absence of afflictions is that when they see the self, they completely abandon the afflictions of humans.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni grong la sogs par de dag gi nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod do //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni grong la sogs par de dag gi nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod do //
translated: The victors’ absence of afflictions is that in villages and so on, they cut the continuity of the afflictions of those.

original: don 'di nyid 'og nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid 'og nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning,

original: yang de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “at that time” and so on.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i tshe'o //
translated: “At that time” means when the Bhagavān is absorbed in samādhi.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word “also” has the meaning of restriction.

original: des na de kho na nyid ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is “just that reality.”

original: yang na yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: Alternatively, “also” has the meaning of inclusion.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya ba bstan pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam par lta ba'i bya ba sdud par byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bya ba bstan pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam par lta ba'i bya ba sdud par byed do //
translated: It includes the activity of meditative equipoise that is taught and the activity of seeing that will occur below.

original: bshad pa 'di la ni 'khor gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i dus kho na yongs su gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la ni 'khor gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i dus kho na yongs su gzung bar bya ste /
translated: This explanation should be understood as referring only to the time when the roots of virtue of the retinue are fully matured.

original: de lta na ni bsdu ba 'thad par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //🔽'di'i sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi ched du 'am /
analyzed: de lta na ni bsdu ba 'thad par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // 'di'i sems dpa' ni byang chub kyi ched du 'am /
translated: In this way, the collection is tenable, not otherwise.🔽The bodhisattva is so called because he is heroic for the sake of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: or because he has the thought of enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba thobs pa rnams la nges pa'i tshig phyi ma nyid du rigs na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir dbang bskur ba thobs pa rnams la nges pa'i tshig phyi ma nyid du rigs na /
translated: If the latter etymology is correct, then the word bodhisattva is applicable to those who have received consecration, because they have entered into buddhahood.

original: byang chub 'di yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub 'di yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this enlightenment?

original: byang chub 'di nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin te rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de skad du /
analyzed: byang chub 'di nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin te rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro // de skad du /
translated: This enlightenment has the characteristic of space, because it is free from all conceptualization.

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las kyang /
translated: As is said in the Vairocanābhisambodhi Tantra:

original: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid pa //
analyzed: byang chub nam mkha'i mtshan nyid pa //
translated: Enlightenment has the characteristic of space,

original: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin /🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin /🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: free from all conceptualization.

original: gang zhig de rtogs par 'dod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de rtogs par 'dod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: One who wishes to realize that is a bodhisattva.

original: de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it means.

original: @270a * // sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid la sogs pa gsum bstan pa dang / sa chen por zhugs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa che ba nyid kyis kyang 'di'i sems dpa' che bas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: @270a * // sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid la sogs pa gsum bstan pa dang / sa chen por zhugs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa che ba nyid kyis kyang 'di'i sems dpa' che bas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The three, the greatness of mind, etc., are taught as the best of all sentient beings, and the greatness of mind of this one is also by the greatness of the perfections of one who has entered the great stages.

original: de skad du sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
translated: Thus it says in the verse summary:🔽Great giving, great mind, great power,🔽entering the supreme vehicle of the victors,

original: gtong ba che dang blo che ba dang mthu che dang // rgyal ba rnams kyi theg chen mchog la zhugs pa dang // go cha chen po bgos shing bdud kyi sgyu 'dul ba //
analyzed: gtong ba che dang blo che ba dang mthu che dang // rgyal ba rnams kyi theg chen mchog la zhugs pa dang // go cha chen po bgos shing bdud kyi sgyu 'dul ba //
translated: wearing the great armor and subduing the illusions of Mara,

original: de yi phyir na sems dpa' che zhes rab tu brjod /
analyzed: de yi phyir na sems dpa' che zhes rab tu brjod /
translated: therefore it is called the great mind.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: It says in the Abhidharmakota:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du bsrings te song bas na 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du bsrings te song bas na 'phags pa'o //
translated: The aryas are those who have gone far from nonvirtuous actions.

original: gang gis spyan ras kyis gzigs na sems can rnams dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: gang gis spyan ras kyis gzigs na sems can rnams dbang phyug ste /
translated: When he is seen, sentient beings are powerful.

original: 'jigs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la mi rten par dbang du gyur pa'i dbang phyug de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la mi rten par dbang du gyur pa'i dbang phyug de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called powerful because he is powerful in the sense of being independent, not dependent on the cause of fear and suffering.

original: 'di 'phags pa yang yin la spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang yin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //🔽rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'am //
analyzed: 'di 'phags pa yang yin la spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang yin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go // rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'am //
translated: He is both a noble one and powerful, thus he is the noble Avalokitesvara.

original: shes pa'i mchog yin pas shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes pa'i mchog yin pas shes rab bo //
translated: It is wisdom because it is the knowledge of the various kinds or the supreme knowledge.

original: dam pa'i dngos po ni dam pa nyid de dam pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i dngos po ni dam pa nyid de dam pa kho na yin no //
translated: The supreme thing is just the supreme itself.

original: 'jig rten gang la mchog gzhan med pa ni dam pa bshad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gang la mchog gzhan med pa ni dam pa bshad de /
translated: The supreme is explained as that which is not surpassed in the world.

original: shes rab kyi dam pa nyid na shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dam pa nyid na shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the supreme wisdom, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na 'di skad du /
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas shes pa dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas shes pa dam par 'gyur te /
translated: Knowledge becomes supreme through the aspect of emptiness of intrinsic reality and so on.

original: shin du mchog dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin du mchog dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: That which is endowed with the most excellent is the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines,

original: kun dga' bo shes rab gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsngo ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdos na de dam pa yin nam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bsngo ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsdos na de dam pa yin nam /
translated: “Ānanda, if the roots of virtue are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by that wisdom, are they the most excellent?”

original: kun dga' bos gsol ba /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol ba /
translated: Ānanda replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das dam pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dam pa lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, they are the most excellent.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dam pa lags so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dam pa lags so //
translated: Sugata, they are the most excellent.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de bas na dam pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na dam pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Therefore, because they are the most excellent, they obtain the name ‘perfection.’”

original: de las gzhan pa la ni nges pa'i tshig rigs pa ma yin zhing sgra sbyar ba yang dka' ba bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'i tshig dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la ni nges pa'i tshig rigs pa ma yin zhing sgra sbyar ba yang dka' ba bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'i tshig dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not logical to etymologize the others, and it is difficult to apply the term. It would contradict the Blessed One’s etymologies.

original: don @270b dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
analyzed: don @270b dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
translated: The ultimate perfection of wisdom is the Dharma Body, whose characteristic is the complete purification of all aspects.

original: de las gzhan pa ni sems bskyed pa dang / go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni sems bskyed pa dang / go cha dang / 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The other perfections are the causal nature, whose characteristic is the practice of generating the mind, armor, engagement, accumulation, and definite emergence.

original: zab mo'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //🔽de la gang gi tshe rgyu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya na ni yul gyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: zab mo'i don ni sngar bshad zin to // de la gang gi tshe rgyu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bya na ni yul gyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: The profound meaning has already been explained.🔽When the causal perfection of wisdom is meant, it is the seventh case, the objective.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu la bya na ni de'i tshe rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu la bya na ni de'i tshe rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: When the resultant perfection of wisdom is meant, then it is the seventh case, the reason.

original: de la spyad pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: de la spyad pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
translated: There are many types of practice.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa sbyor ba'i lam la ni mos pa'i spyad pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa sbyor ba'i lam la ni mos pa'i spyad pa'o //
translated: On the path of preparation of the stage of ordinary beings, it is the practice of aspiration.

original: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i drug la ni sgrub pa'i spyad pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i drug la ni sgrub pa'i spyad pa'o //
translated: On the six stages beginning with the second, it is the practice of accomplishment.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni nges pa'i spyad pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni nges pa'i spyad pa'o //
translated: On the eighth stage, it is the practice of certainty.

original: de la mos pa'i spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i spyad pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The practice of devoted interest is threefold:

original: rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang / gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang / gzhan gyi don te /
translated: for one's own benefit, for the benefit of oneself and others, and for the benefit of others.

original: re re la yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu dgu'o //
analyzed: re re la yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu dgu'o //
translated: Each of these is ninefold, divided into lesser lesser and so on.

original: de ltar mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: Thus there are twenty seven kinds of devoted interest.

original: sgrub pa'i spyad pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i spyad pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The practice of accomplishment is the essence of the purity of the three trainings, higher morality and so on.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second stage is the purity of the training in higher morality.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third stage is the purity of the training in higher mind.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The eight stages are the purity of the training in higher wisdom.

original: des ni sa lhag ma brgyad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sa lhag ma brgyad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus the remaining eight stages are included in that.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni 'od 'phro ba can la sogs pas bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni 'od 'phro ba can la sogs pas bzhi ste /
translated: The four stages of the radiant and so on are due to the purity of the training in higher wisdom, which is endowed with the factors of enlightenment, the four noble truths, dependent origination, and the state of signlessness with effort.

original: de ltar na rnam pa drug ni sgrub pa'i spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa drug ni sgrub pa'i spyad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the six aspects are the practice of accomplishment.

original: nges pa'i spyad pa ni lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i spyad pa ni lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa'i lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pas ni sa brgyad pa ste /
translated: The practice of ascertainment is due to the purity of the training in higher wisdom, which is spontaneous and signless, on the eighth stage.

original: ji ltar 'dod par sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa la spyod pa nges pas na nges pa'i spyad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa la spyod pa nges pas na nges pa'i spyad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the practice of ascertainment because the purification of the buddhaverse is ascertained as desired.

original: 'dir ni bye brag ma bzung ba'i phyir spyad pa nyid thams cad bzung ngo //🔽spyad pa ni spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni bye brag ma bzung ba'i phyir spyad pa nyid thams cad bzung ngo // spyad pa ni spyod pa ste /
translated: Here, since no distinction is made, all practices are included.🔽Practice is conduct.

original: rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the subsequent accomplishment.

original: yang na mos pa nyid spyad pa yin te /🔽'di rtsom pa'i sa yin @271a * //
analyzed: yang na mos pa nyid spyad pa yin te / 'di rtsom pa'i sa yin @271a * //
translated: Or else, it is the practice of devotion,

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the stage of the composition of this.

original: 'di nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig po brtsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig po brtsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the composition of the eleven stages, beginning with the Joyous.

original: thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / rnam par dag pa ni de bas gzhan pas lhag ma rnams kyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: thob pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / rnam par dag pa ni de bas gzhan pas lhag ma rnams kyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Attainment, perfection, and purification are established by the other stages.

original: yul de la 'ang de'i ched du spyod pa nyid la rnam par blta ste /
analyzed: yul de la 'ang de'i ched du spyod pa nyid la rnam par blta ste /
translated: And in regard to that object, the practice is considered in terms of its purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das mdzad pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid du zhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mdzad pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid du zhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: The Lord has entered into conformity with the deeds of the Bodhisattvas,

original: las gzhan byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las gzhan byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but he does not perform any other action.

original: 'khor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'khor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Other retinues have also entered into conformity with the deeds of the Tathagata,

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'chad pa po yin pa'i phyir de lta bu zhugs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'chad pa po yin pa'i phyir de lta bu zhugs so zhes bstan to //
translated: but it is taught that Avalokitesvara has entered in that way because he is the expounder.

original: sh'a ri'i bu yang 'dri ba po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yang 'dri ba po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And Sariputra is the questioner.

original: rnam par blta ste zhes 'byung ba ni rang gi ngo bo stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su lta ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par blta ste zhes 'byung ba ni rang gi ngo bo stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su lta ba ste /
translated: The phrase one should view means that one should view the emptiness of intrinsic reality and so on in various aspects.

original: so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: This is discernment.

original: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis rang gi dngos po stong pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa rnams kyi lta ba khyad par can du bzhed do //
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis rang gi dngos po stong pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa rnams kyi lta ba khyad par can du bzhed do //
translated: If the phrase in this way appears in some texts, then the phrase in this way indicates that one should view the emptiness of intrinsic reality, the absence of characteristics, the unborn, and so on, which will be explained below, as special aspects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi don brjod pa rnam par gyi sgrar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs kyi don brjod pa rnam par gyi sgrar sbyor ro //
translated: For that very reason, the word various is applied to the word view.

original: rnam par blta bar bya pa ji snyed yod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par blta bar bya pa ji snyed yod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the various views,

original: phung po lnga po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po lnga po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, the five aggregates.

original: phung po'i sgras skye mched dang khams kyang mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i sgras skye mched dang khams kyang mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The word aggregate also indicates the sense bases and elements,

original: mjug sdud pa na de dag kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa na de dag kyang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are also mentioned in the concluding summary.

original: yang na kyang gi sgras phung po lnga dang skye mched dang / khams rnams la yang rnam par lta'o//
analyzed: yang na kyang gi sgras phung po lnga dang skye mched dang / khams rnams la yang rnam par lta'o//
translated: Or else, the word “also” indicates that he also views the five aggregates, the sense bases, and the elements.

original: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes 'byung ba 'dis ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod par bstan te /
analyzed: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes 'byung ba 'dis ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod par bstan te /
translated: “They are empty of an intrinsic nature” indicates that they exist as they are.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / bral ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dang / bral ba dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they are empty of an intrinsic nature, devoid of an intrinsic nature, and without an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di yang mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa mtshon pa yin no //
translated: This also illustrates the absence of characteristics, non-arising, and so forth.

original: de nas zhes 'byung ba ni skabs 'dir de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes 'byung ba ni skabs 'dir de ma thag tu'o //
translated: “Then” means at this juncture, immediately.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i mthu ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i mthu ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus te /
translated: “The power of the Buddha’s activity” means the power of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It means the power of the Bhagavān’s blessing and activity.

original: don 'di 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri ba'i spobs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bsgrubs @271b pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dri ba'i spobs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bsgrubs @271b pa yin no //
translated: This meaning was established by the Bhagavān, who inspired the noble Avalokiteśvara to ask about it.

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'di sh'a ri'i bu'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'di sh'a ri'i bu'i yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, this would not be the domain of Śāriputra.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pas bsngags par 'os pa'i sgo nas tshe dang ldan pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pas bsngags par 'os pa'i sgo nas tshe dang ldan pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is called the Venerable One because he is praised for abandoning the afflictions.

original: sh'a ri'i zhes bya ba ni sha ra dvad kyi rigs su skyes pa'i bud med do //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i zhes bya ba ni sha ra dvad kyi rigs su skyes pa'i bud med do //
translated: Śāriputra is a woman born in the Śāri clan.

original: de'i bu yin pas sh'a ri'i bu'o//
analyzed: de'i bu yin pas sh'a ri'i bu'o//
translated: He is the son of that woman, so he is Śāriputra.

original: 'di skad ces 'byung ba ni 'og nas smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces 'byung ba ni 'og nas smos pa'o //
translated: This is said means what is stated below.

original: smras so zhes 'byung ba ni smras par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smras so zhes 'byung ba ni smras par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He said means what will be said.

original: bsngags par bya ba'i don du rigs kyi bu zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: bsngags par bya ba'i don du rigs kyi bu zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Son of good family is stated for the purpose of praise.

original: dbang bskur ba thob pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir 'di ni bong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir 'di ni bong ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning: because he is the special son of the Buddhas, having attained consecration.

original: gang la la zhes 'byung ba ni bye brag ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la la zhes 'byung ba ni bye brag ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Whoever is stated without distinction.

original: spyod par zhes 'byung ba ni spyod par byed pa dang / nan tan gyis yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: spyod par zhes 'byung ba ni spyod par byed pa dang / nan tan gyis yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The term “practice” means to practice, to accomplish with effort.

original: 'dod pa ni 'di'i 'dun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'di'i 'dun pa yin te /
translated: Desire is the aspiration for that.

original: de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by that.

original: yi ge kha cig las spyad pa byed par 'dod pa des zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las spyad pa byed par 'dod pa des zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts, the term “practice” is “to practice that.”

original: byed pa dang sgrub par zhes bya ba khyad par med pa nyid kyi don to //🔽bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang / rtogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis ji ltar bslab par bya /
analyzed: byed pa dang sgrub par zhes bya ba khyad par med pa nyid kyi don to // bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / sgrub pa dang / rtogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis ji ltar bslab par bya /
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference between “to practice” and “to accomplish.”🔽By what aspects of intention, application, realization, accomplishment, and realization should one train?

original: goms par bya /
analyzed: goms par bya /
translated: How should one cultivate?

original: de skad ces 'byung ba ni rnam pa snga ma la bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces 'byung ba ni rnam pa snga ma la bya'o //
translated: This is how it appears in the earlier version.

original: smras pa dang zhes 'byung ba ni brjod ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa dang zhes 'byung ba ni brjod ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “to say” means to express.

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes 'byung ba ni 'di 'phags pa rnams kyis brjod par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo zhes 'byung ba ni 'di 'phags pa rnams kyis brjod par 'os pa yin no //
translated: The term “son or daughter of noble family” means that this is worthy to be expressed by the noble ones.

original: 'am zhes 'byung ba'i sgra ni phan tshun ltos pa ste gnyi ga yang yin par lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes 'byung ba'i sgra ni phan tshun ltos pa ste gnyi ga yang yin par lta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “or” indicates mutual dependence, and both should be viewed.

original: des zhes 'byung ba spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: des zhes 'byung ba spyad pa spyod par 'dod pas so //
translated: “By that” refers to the desire to practice.

original: 'di ltar zhes 'byung ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes 'byung ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “In this way” refers to the method that will be explained below.

original: rnam par blta bar bya ste zhes 'byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par blta bar bya ste zhes 'byung ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: “One should view” means one should investigate in various ways.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gis dmigs pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gis dmigs pa brjod do //
translated: This describes the object of insight as a conceptual image.

original: sems pa'i bar ma chad pa nyid gcig tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i bar ma chad pa nyid gcig tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The object of serenity is a nonconceptual image, which is a single, uninterrupted state of attention.

original: yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes 'byung ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yang dag par ram /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes 'byung ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yang dag par ram /
translated: “One should view” means one should view it correctly, without error.

original: mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis dbyer med pa'i phyir mnyam par ram /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis dbyer med pa'i phyir mnyam par ram /
translated: Or, it means one should view it as the same, because it is undifferentiated by the absence of characteristics.

original: chos thams cad kyi phyir kun tu rnam par lta ba dang rjes su mthun par lta ba ni yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi phyir kun tu rnam par lta ba dang rjes su mthun par lta ba ni yang dag par rjes su lta ba ste /
translated: The object of the limit of existence is the object of the path of insight, which is included in the first stage.🔽Then, above that, the limit of existence is the object of the path of meditative development, which is included in the remaining stages.

original: dngos po'i @272a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i @272a * //
translated: The object of the limit of existence should be regarded as threefold:🔽the object of the limit of existence, the object of the former and latter limits and the object of the non-relinquishment of the limit of existence.🔽The object of the limit of existence is the object of the path of insight, which is included in the first stage.

original: mtha'i dmigs pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtha'i dmigs pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object of the former and latter limits is the object of the path of meditative development, which is included in the remaining stages.🔽The object of the non-relinquishment of the limit of existence is the object of the Buddha stage.

original: 'dis ni dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sa dang po bstan to //🔽de nas gong du dngos po'i mtha' dang / sngar bstan pa rnam pa gnyis te /🔽sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni dmigs pa gsum po de dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i sa dang po bstan to // de nas gong du dngos po'i mtha' dang / sngar bstan pa rnam pa gnyis te / sa gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni dmigs pa gsum po de dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The object of the limit of existence is the object of the path of insight, which is included in the first stage.🔽The object of the former and latter limits is the object of the path of meditative development, which is included in the remaining stages.

original: sa mthar phyin pa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su grub pa de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa mthar phyin pa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su grub pa de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object of the non-relinquishment of the limit of existence is the object of the Buddha stage.

original: de skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: Thus, in the noble Sandhinirmocana Sutra, it is said:

original: de sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Because he has previously attained serenity and insight, he has attained the object of observation that is a reflection that is conceptual and non-conceptual.

original: da ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Now, because he has attained the path of seeing, he has attained the object of observation that is the limit of entities.

original: des gong nas gong du bsgom pa'i lam dang rab tu ldan pa dmigs pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed na mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad bcom pa'i phyir mthar gyis sa gong nas gong du gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong zhing bla
analyzed: des gong nas gong du bsgom pa'i lam dang rab tu ldan pa dmigs pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed na mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad bcom pa'i phyir mthar gyis sa gong nas gong du gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong zhing bla
translated: When he attends to just those three objects of observation in association with the path of meditation that is higher than that, he purifies his mind like gold, in stages, higher and higher, in order to destroy all signs and the bad states of mind.

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang 'thob po zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang 'thob po zhes gsungs te /
translated: He attains the object of observation that is the accomplishment of the purpose, up to and including the complete and true enlightenment of unsurpassed buddhahood.

original: rgyas par ni de nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni de nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail from that very text.

original: 'dir ni dpe nye bar sbyar ba tsam zhig smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dpe nye bar sbyar ba tsam zhig smos pa yin no //
translated: Here, the example is merely applied.

original: ji ltar na rang gi dngos po stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa la rnam par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yang dag pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang gi dngos po stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa la rnam par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir yang dag pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam pa dang /
translated: How is it that the view of the aggregates, etc., through the aspects of emptiness, etc., of their own natures, is correct because it is non-erroneous, is equal because it is of one characteristic through the absence of characteristics,

original: chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: and is the correct view of all dharmas?

original: gzugs stong pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'o zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: It is said, “Form is empty.”

original: skabs yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because the context is that of the aggregates, etc., the phrase “by own-nature” is supplied.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba la dngos po yin pa dang / btags pa yin par smra ba rnams rnam pa de gnyis su rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs par snang ba la dngos po yin pa dang / btags pa yin par smra ba rnams rnam pa de gnyis su rtogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, those who maintain that what appears as form, etc. is a real entity or a designation understand it in those two ways.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba dngos po yin par smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba dngos po yin par smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas and the Naiyāyikas and so on maintain that the appearance of form and so on is a real entity.

original: don snang ba btags pa yin par smra ba ni mdo sde pa ste /
analyzed: don snang ba btags pa yin par smra ba ni mdo sde pa ste /
translated: The Sautrāntikas maintain that the appearance of objects is a designation.

original: de dag 'di skad du don ni sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol @272b na yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du don ni sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol @272b na yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: They say that the external object such as blue and so on is a real entity.

original: myong ba ni rnam par shes pa 'di la rnam pa gang bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: myong ba ni rnam par shes pa 'di la rnam pa gang bsgom pa yin no //
translated: The aspect that is cultivated in this consciousness is the experience.

original: sngon po la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bor rnam par rtog pa mang po rdul phra rab dang / des brtsams pa cha shas can dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gtso bo dang / sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa tha dad par rtog pa'i dra ba ngan pa de dag thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo bkag pa nyid kyis bcom par 'gyur bas de nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bor rnam par rtog pa mang po rdul phra rab dang / des brtsams pa cha shas can dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gtso bo dang / sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa tha dad par rtog pa'i dra ba ngan pa de dag thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo bkag pa nyid kyis bcom par 'gyur bas de nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: The many nets of bad conceptions that conceive the essence of blue and so on to be different in terms of a subtle particle, a partless particle, consciousness, pradhāna, ākāśa, and so on are all destroyed by the mere refutation of their essence, so that will be stated.

original: gang de dag ba lang rdzi dang bud med yan chad la grags pa dngos su gsal bar snang ba'i gzugs de nyid dri za'i grong khyer ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te ;
analyzed: gang de dag ba lang rdzi dang bud med yan chad la grags pa dngos su gsal bar snang ba'i gzugs de nyid dri za'i grong khyer ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin te ;
translated: That form which is evident and appears to be real, and which is well known even to cowherds and women, is empty of an intrinsic reality, like a city of gandharvas.

original: gzugs snang ba 'di la rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs snang ba 'di la rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang med do //
translated: This appearance of form has no reality whatsoever.

original: de bas na rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid 'di la gzugs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid 'di la gzugs so zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this emptiness of intrinsic reality is called “form.”

original: 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i gzugs rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i gzugs rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the form asserted by the Vaibhāṣikas and the Mīmāṃsakas and so on is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: mdo sde pa rnams snang ba rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs par snang ba ni don gyi rang gi ngo bos stong pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams snang ba rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs par snang ba ni don gyi rang gi ngo bos stong pa yin no //
translated: Because the Sautrāntikas assert that appearances are the nature of consciousness, the appearance of blue and so on is empty of the intrinsic reality of the object.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni yod pa kho na yin pas stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni yod pa kho na yin pas stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that external objects exist and that form is different from emptiness,

original: de dag kyang gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And this is stated in the following:🔽Emptiness is not other than form.

original: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'dis 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no zhes 'byung ba 'dis 'gog par byed do //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: yang 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par ga las shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di skad du phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par ga las shes par bya zhe na /
translated: Again, it may be asked, “How is it known that the aggregates and so on do not have their own intrinsic reality?”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid kyi sa phyogs bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid kyi sa phyogs bsal ba yin no //
translated: Since the aggregates, the sources, and the constituents are dependently arisen, the positions of causelessness and permanence are eliminated.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i phyogs la yang rtag pa gnyis te /🔽dngos po skye ba na rgyu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du skye 'am /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i phyogs la yang rtag pa gnyis te / dngos po skye ba na rgyu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du skye 'am /
translated: In the position of arising from a cause, there are two types of permanence:

original: dus tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa yin /
translated: When a thing arises, does it arise simultaneously with its cause or at a different time?

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu snga phyi'i phyogs thams cad dus gcig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dbyer med pa dang / bskal pa yang lo gcig tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu snga phyi'i phyogs thams cad dus gcig tu dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dbyer med pa dang / bskal pa yang lo gcig tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were the first case, then cause and effect would be observed at the same time in all cases of prior and subsequent, and cause and effect would be indistinguishable, and an eon would be reduced to a single year.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu tshogs pa med pa'i phyir nus pa med de /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu tshogs pa med pa'i phyir nus pa med de /
translated: In the second case, also, there is no capability because cause and effect do not assemble at the same time.

original: de bas na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu med na ni rtag tu yod pa'am med pa @273a * //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // rgyu med na ni rtag tu yod pa'am med pa @273a * //
translated: Therefore, it follows that there would be no cause.

original: nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no cause, it follows that there would be eternal existence or nonexistence,

original: ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no other basis for dependence.

original: ltos na ni dngos po res 'ga' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos na ni dngos po res 'ga' ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were dependence, there would be the occasional nature of things.

original: gsum pa'i phyogs ni mi srid de /
analyzed: gsum pa'i phyogs ni mi srid de /
translated: The third case is impossible,

original: dus gcig pa dang dus tha dad pa gnyis phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig pa dang dus tha dad pa gnyis phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because simultaneity and difference in time are mutually exclusive.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de dag smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba gang yin pa de dag smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo stong pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever appearances there are of form and so on are empty of their own entities, like the water in a mirage and so on.

original: de dag la yang de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba zhes rtog pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: de dag la yang de dang de la brten nas 'byung ba zhes rtog pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob yin no //
translated: The conception that they arise in dependence on this and that is the conventional.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa las /
translated: For that very reason, the Lord said in the noble extensive sport sutra:

original: sh'akya'i sras po rten cing 'brel pa'i chos //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras po rten cing 'brel pa'i chos //
translated: The son of the Shakya sees dependent origination

original: rang gi ngo bo med par mthong nas ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med par mthong nas ni //
translated: and sees it as devoid of its own entity.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang rab ldan pas //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang rab ldan pas //
translated: Having a mind like space,

original: g-yon can dpung bcas mthong bas g-yo ba med /
analyzed: g-yon can dpung bcas mthong bas g-yo ba med /
translated: he is unmoved by seeing the demon and his army.

original: ces 'byung ba dang / dkon mchog ta la la las kyang /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba dang / dkon mchog ta la la las kyang /
translated: And in the Jewel Cloud sutra:🔽What arises from conditions does not arise;

original: rkyen las skyes pa rang gi dngos ma skyes //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa rang gi dngos ma skyes //
translated: it does not arise by virtue of its own nature.

original: chos kyi lus ni rgyal ba rnams kyi sku //
analyzed: chos kyi lus ni rgyal ba rnams kyi sku //
translated: The body of dharma is the body of the victors.

original: chos nyid rtag tu gnas pa nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: chos nyid rtag tu gnas pa nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: The nature of reality always abides like space.

original: bstan na chos rnams sbyong ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan na chos rnams sbyong ba thob par 'gyur //
translated: When it is taught, one attains the purification of phenomena.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: So it is said.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan las kyang /
translated: And in the Ornament of the Light of Gnosis Entering the Domain of All Buddhas, it says:

original: chos kyi rang bzhin las g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin las g-yo ba med do //
translated: It does not move from the nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin las ma g-yos pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin las ma g-yos pa ni chos kyi rang bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not moving from the nature of phenomena, one attains the nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin thob pa ni cung zad kyang spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin thob pa ni cung zad kyang spros par mi byed do //
translated: Having attained the nature of phenomena, one does not elaborate on anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is produced by causes and conditions.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa de ni shin tu ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa de ni shin tu ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That which is produced by causes and conditions is utterly unproduced.

original: gang shin tu ma skyes pa de ni nges par thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang shin tu ma skyes pa de ni nges par thob pa yin no //
translated: That which is utterly unproduced is ascertained.🔽That which is ascertained does not abide together with the mental activity of any phenomenon.

original: gang nges par thob pa de ni chos thams cad yid la byed pa dang lhan cig gnas byed pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang nges par thob pa de ni chos thams cad yid la byed pa dang lhan cig gnas byed pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: So it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: For that very reason, the noble Nāgārjuna also says:

original: rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence and connection

original: rang bzhin gyis ni de ma skyes //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni de ma skyes //
translated: Does not arise by its own intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni gang ma skyes //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni gang ma skyes //
translated: Whatever does not arise by its own intrinsic reality

original: de la skye zhes ji skad bya //
analyzed: de la skye zhes ji skad bya //
translated: How could it arise?

original: shin tu phra ba'i dngos la yang //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i dngos la yang //
translated: Even in the most subtle things

original: gang gis skye bar rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: gang gis skye bar rnam brtags pa //
translated: Whatever arises is imagined.

original: rnam par mi mkhas de yis ni //🔽rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
analyzed: rnam par mi mkhas de yis ni // rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
translated: The unwise

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Do not see the meaning of arising from conditions.🔽Another enumeration: Imagined form, the dependent characteristic, is always and forever free from the two kinds of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @273b mtshan nyid gnyis kyis rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su bral ba stong pa de ni
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i @273b mtshan nyid gnyis kyis rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang ther zug ther zug gi dus su bral ba stong pa de ni
translated: That emptiness is

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs te /
translated: the form of reality.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of the perfected.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa de gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes 'byung ba 'di gcig pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa de gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes 'byung ba 'di gcig pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The statement “emptiness is form” shows that the other-dependent and the real are the same.

original: stong pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo dang / gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo dang / gzugs gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid du nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is ascertained that emptiness, which is the nature of the real, and form, which is the characteristic of the other-dependent, are the same,

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nyid smos pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nyid smos pa yin no //
translated: the statement “emptiness is form” is made.

original: de ltar gcig pa nyid sgrub pa'i sgo nas brjod nas dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: de ltar gcig pa nyid sgrub pa'i sgo nas brjod nas dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang /
