translated: Having thus expressed the sameness by way of establishing it, he refutes the difference by way of refuting it,

original: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas tha dad pa nyid 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas tha dad pa nyid 'gog par byed do //
translated: saying “emptiness is not other than form,” and so on.

original: de yang mi 'gyur ba dang phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mi 'gyur ba dang phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the real because it is unchanging and nonerroneous.

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus nas nus par gyur pas ma byas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus nas nus par gyur pas ma byas pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
translated: It is unconditioned because it is not produced by the combination of causes and conditions.

original: de las gzhan pa gnyis ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gnyis ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: The other two are not established.

original: rgyun chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
translated: It is permanent because it is not interrupted.

original: de ni thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku don dam par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku don dam par yod pa yin no //
translated: This is the ultimate existence of the Dharma Body of the Great Muni.

original: de nyid gcig kho na don dam pa bden pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gcig kho na don dam pa bden pa ste /
translated: This is the one and only ultimate truth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: ma rmongs pa'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rmongs pa'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the Dharma that is not confused is called nirvana.

original: de lta ma yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes grags te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes grags te /
translated: Otherwise, all striving would be pointless.

original: de la bshad pa ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa la ni rag na don dam par yod ces bya ba de ji lta bu /
analyzed: de la bshad pa ji skad bstan pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid 'dod pa la ni rag na don dam par yod ces bya ba de ji lta bu /
translated: Here, we reply: If you accept the characteristics of the Dharma Body as they have been taught, then what is this ultimate existence?

original: 'di ltar de mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa bdag la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar de mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa bdag la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa yin nam /
translated: Is it permanent like the self and so on imagined by the tīrthikas?

original: skad cig ma yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin /
translated: Or is it momentary?

original: ci ste phyogs dang po yin na ni mu stegs can rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las 'di bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs dang po yin na ni mu stegs can rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' las 'di bye brag ci yod /
translated: If the former, how does it differ from the tenets of the tīrthikas who propound the Vedānta and so on?

original: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
translated: The Samādhirāja-sūtra says,

original: chos kun rtag tu rang gi ngo pos stong /
analyzed: chos kun rtag tu rang gi ngo pos stong /
translated: All phenomena are always empty of their own entities.🔽The sons of the victors destroy all things;

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'jig / srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams dngos po rnam par 'jig / srid pa thams cad yong ye stong pa ste //
translated: All existences are utterly empty.

original: nyi tshe'i stong nyid mu stegs can rnams kyi //
analyzed: nyi tshe'i stong nyid mu stegs can rnams kyi //
translated: The emptiness of the limited is that of the heterodox.

original: zhes pa yang ji ltar rtogs par bya ;
analyzed: zhes pa yang ji ltar rtogs par bya ;
translated: How should this be understood?

original: mu stegs can rnams la yang ji ltar skyon gdags /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams la yang ji ltar skyon gdags /
translated: How can the error be imputed to the heterodox?

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na de'i tshe skad cig ma snga ma ni skad cig ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na de'i tshe skad cig ma snga ma ni skad cig ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin la /
translated: If it is the second case, then the earlier moment is the cause of the later moment.

original: de la yang dus mnyam pa dang / dus tha dad pa'i skyon sngar bstan zin pas yang mi brjod do //🔽gang yang gcig kho na dam pa bden pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs @274a * //
analyzed: de la yang dus mnyam pa dang / dus tha dad pa'i skyon sngar bstan zin pas yang mi brjod do // gang yang gcig kho na dam pa bden pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs @274a * //
translated: The errors of simultaneity and difference of time have already been explained and so will not be discussed here.

original: pa smras pa 'di yang mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'dod pa de dag gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa smras pa 'di yang mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par 'dod pa de dag gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa yin te /
translated: The statement “Only one is the highest truth” and so on is also a statement of implied meaning for the purpose of introducing those who aspire to nirvana.

original: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pa las /
translated: As it says in the Aksﬁayamatisﬁrā

original: ci ste 'dus byas med na /
analyzed: ci ste 'dus byas med na /
translated: If the conditioned does not exist,🔽then what is it that is stopped when nirvana is truly existent?

original: gang 'gog na mya ngan las 'das pa bden par 'gyur zhes bya bas de dag thams cad bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang 'gog na mya ngan las 'das pa bden par 'gyur zhes bya bas de dag thams cad bsal ba yin no //
translated: All of these are refuted.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las kyang /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines and so on also says:

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: A perfect buddha is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: Nirvana is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes pa smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ste mya ngan las 'das pa las ches lhag pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na de yang sgyu ma lta bu rmi lam lta bu'o zhes pa smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: If there were any phenomenon superior to nirvana, I would say that it is like an illusion, like a dream.

original: rtsom pa don yod par 'gyur ba ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa don yod par 'gyur ba ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: That the undertaking is meaningful will be shown below.

original: ci ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rnam par bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don dam par yod par khas mi len na ji ltar med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / rnam par bral ba gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don dam par yod par khas mi len na ji ltar med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept that nondual wisdom, which is free from the duality of object and subject, exists ultimately, then how could it not be nonexistent?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be.

original: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas len pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas len pa'i phyir dang / don dam par yang yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opposite of existence is

original: yod pa nyid las bzlog ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid las bzlog ste /
translated: grasping at nonexistence.

original: med pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'di ltar med par lta ba chad pa'i mtha' yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'di ltar med par lta ba chad pa'i mtha' yin te /
translated: In this way, the view of nonexistence is the extreme of nihilism.

original: pha med do //
analyzed: pha med do //
translated: There is no father.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: There is no mother.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: There is no this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //🔽legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa can yin na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do // legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do zhes bya ba dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa can yin na /
translated: There is no other world.🔽There is no result of good or bad actions.🔽There is no truth, no jewels, and so on.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa dbu ma'i lugs la lta skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa dbu ma'i lugs la lta skabs ga la yod /
translated: If this is the kind of evil that is characterized by the denial of the truth, then how could it be the occasion for the utterly pure Madhyamaka system?

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
translated: Also, Nāgārjuna’s Precious Garland says:

original: smin rgyu las ni chu'o zhes //
analyzed: smin rgyu las ni chu'o zhes //
translated: From the cause of ripening, some say, “It is water.”

original: chu yi blo yis der song nas //
analyzed: chu yi blo yis der song nas //
translated: Having gone there with the thought of water,

original: ci ste chu de med do zhes //
analyzed: ci ste chu de med do zhes //
translated: If you say, “That water does not exist,”

original: 'dzin pa de ni rmongs pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dzin pa de ni rmongs pa nyid //
translated: That apprehension is just ignorance.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / gang la med par 'dod pa la //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / gang la med par 'dod pa la //
translated: And also:

original: byang chub brten phyir sems med cing //
analyzed: byang chub brten phyir sems med cing //
translated: Since enlightenment is based on that,🔽There is no mind, no assertion, and no activity.

original: khas len med dang spyod med dang // de la ji ltar med par shes ;🔽/ zhes bya bas kyang lan btab po //
analyzed: khas len med dang spyod med dang // de la ji ltar med par shes ; / zhes bya bas kyang lan btab po //
translated: How could it be known as nonexistent?

original: ji ste yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, “It becomes nonexistent because existence is refuted,”

original: med pa nyid du bkag pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa nyid du bkag pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: why wouldn’t it also become existent because nonexistence is refuted?

original: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa don dam par yong par khas len pa yang rgyu tha dad par 'jug pa rnams la de dag gi shes @274b pa rnam par 'dzin na ni ji ltar gnyis su med pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa don dam par yong par khas len pa yang rgyu tha dad par 'jug pa rnams la de dag gi shes @274b pa rnam par 'dzin na ni ji ltar gnyis su med pa nyid yin /
translated: If you accept that nondual consciousness exists ultimately and you apprehend the consciousnesses of those who engage in different causes, how could it be nondual?

original: 'on te don dam par yod pa la mi 'dzin na ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par yod pa la mi 'dzin na ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin /
translated: But if you do not apprehend it as ultimately existent, how could it be omniscience?

original: khyed la yang skyon 'di mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang skyon 'di mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This fault is the same for you.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: No, it does not.

original: don dam par yod pa mi mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa mi mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin la /
translated: Not seeing ultimate existence is itself seeing reality.

original: smig rgyu la chur mi mthong ba mi shes pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur mi mthong ba mi shes pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But not seeing a mirage as water is not ignorance.

original: de skad du gzugs ma mthong ba nyid gzugs mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du gzugs ma mthong ba nyid gzugs mthong ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: Thus it is said, “Not seeing form is itself seeing form,” and so on, and in the Samādhirāja it says,

original: gang yang ma mthong ba ni chos thams cad mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang ma mthong ba ni chos thams cad mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Not seeing anything is seeing all phenomena.”

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang 'dra bar tshor ba la sogs pa na tha ma rnam par shes pa la thug pa phung po dag mdor na rang gi ngo bos stong pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang 'dra bar tshor ba la sogs pa na tha ma rnam par shes pa la thug pa phung po dag mdor na rang gi ngo bos stong pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, just as with form, feeling and the rest, up to and including consciousness, are taught in brief to be empty of their own entities.

original: des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste /🔽tshor ba stong pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste / tshor ba stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood:🔽Feeling is empty.

original: stong pa nyid tshor ba'o //🔽tshor ba las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid tshor ba'o // tshor ba las stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is feeling.🔽Feeling is not other than emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid las tshor ba gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las tshor ba gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not other than feeling.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, one should apply this to perception and so on.

original: phung po rnams rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid du bstan nas skye mched dang khams rnams la yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid du bstan nas skye mched dang khams rnams la yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the aggregates to be empty of their own intrinsic reality, in order to teach the sense bases and elements,

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, “Śāriputra, thus…” and so on.

original: de ltar na zhes 'byung ba ni phung po bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes 'byung ba ni phung po bzhin du'o //
translated: “Thus” means like the aggregates.

original: chos thams cad ni skye mched dang khams rnams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skye mched dang khams rnams te /
translated: All phenomena are the sense bases and elements.

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid de zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid de zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “They are empty of their own intrinsic reality” is supplied.

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la rnam par lta ba'i rnam pa bstan nas mtshan nyid med pa la rnam par lta ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la rnam par lta ba'i rnam pa bstan nas mtshan nyid med pa la rnam par lta ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the aspect of seeing the emptiness of their own intrinsic reality, in order to teach the aspect of seeing the absence of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he said, “The absence of characteristics…”

original: 'dis sam de mtshon par bya ba yin pas mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis sam de mtshon par bya ba yin pas mtshan nyid de /
translated: Since this is characterized or that is characterized by it, it is a characteristic.

original: 'di lta ste gzugs kyi phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung bas gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs kyi phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung bas gzugs so //
translated: The general characteristic of the aggregate of form is that it is capable of materiality, thus it is form.

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni myong bas na tshor ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni myong bas na tshor ba'o //
translated: The general characteristic of the aggregate of feeling is that it is experienced, thus it is feeling.

original: rang gi ngo bo la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference in their intrinsic natures?

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i bye brag yod do //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis byas pa'i bye brag yod do //
translated: There is a difference in their intrinsic natures and general characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Intrinsic nature is the intrinsic identity of something.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Blue, etc., are the intrinsic natures of things that are not shared in common.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos gang dag yin pa thams cad la spyi'i mtshan nyid de dag med pas de mtshan nyid med pas so //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi chos gang dag yin pa thams cad la spyi'i mtshan nyid de dag med pas de mtshan nyid med pas so //
translated: Since all phenomena of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are devoid of those general characteristics, they are said to be without characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid med pa nyid la sogs pa de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos dgag pas ngo bos bsgrim mi dgos par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa nyid la sogs pa de dag kyang rang gi ngo bos dgag pas ngo bos bsgrim mi dgos par grub pa yin no //
translated: Those without characteristics, etc., are established by intrinsic identity, and so are established without the need for any other characteristics.

original: ci ste chos thams @275a * //
analyzed: ci ste chos thams @275a * //
translated: If all phenomena are without characteristics, how can they be established?

original: cad stong pa dang mtshan nyid med pa yin na de ji ltar rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin las skye zhing rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin 'gags pas 'gag ce na /
analyzed: cad stong pa dang mtshan nyid med pa yin na de ji ltar rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin las skye zhing rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin 'gags pas 'gag ce na /
translated: If all are empty and without characteristics, how do they arise from their conditions as they are, and how do they cease as they are from their conditions?

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: Thus, the limbs of existence arise from the condition of ignorance,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams skye ba dang ; ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'gag pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams skye ba dang ; ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'gag pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the condition of compositional activity, and so forth, and the limbs of existence cease from the cessation of ignorance, the cessation of compositional activity, and so forth. In order to teach that those do not exist in this perfection of wisdom,

original: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “unborn and unceasing” is stated.

original: gal te de ltar na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can the four noble truths of affliction and purification together with their causes be tenable?

original: dri ma med pa dri ma dang bral ba med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa dri ma dang bral ba med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that they are stainless and free of stains.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir chos thams cad dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir chos thams cad dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Because the nature of the stain of affliction does not exist, all phenomena are stainless.

original: dri ma bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dri ma bsal ba'i sgo nas rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because there is no purification by removing stains, it is said that they are naturally free of stains,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are naturally luminous.

original: gal te de ltar na mi g-yo ba'i sa la mtshan ma'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med par gnas pas skyon bri ba dang / sngar ji ltar rigs par ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun tu rmongs pa la sogs pa spangs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mi g-yo ba'i sa la mtshan ma'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med par gnas pas skyon bri ba dang / sngar ji ltar rigs par ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun tu rmongs pa la sogs pa spangs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then because the stage of immovability is the spontaneous, signless abiding that abandons the fault of signs, how could it be that the faults are diminished and the afflictions of the lower realms, complete delusion, and so on are abandoned as they were previously?

original: bri ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bri ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “without decrease” is stated.

original: 'dir skyon zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir skyon zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, “fault” should be seen.

original: de bzhin du sa dgu pa la sogs pa gsum la go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa chen po dang / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir yon tan rnams kyis rgyas pa nyid med par bstan pa'i don du gang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dgu pa la sogs pa gsum la go rims bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa chen po dang / sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir yon tan rnams kyis rgyas pa nyid med par bstan pa'i don du gang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, on the three stages beginning with the ninth, respectively, the qualities are taught to be without increase in order to demonstrate that the qualities are not increased by the attainment of the analytical knowledges, the great superknowledges, and the unobstructed wisdom.

original: 'dir yang yon tan gyis zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang yon tan gyis zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, “qualities” should be supplied.

original: dkon mchog za ma tog gi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dkon mchog za ma tog gi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Ratnārcisūtra says:

original: de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in this way.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa brgyad kho na dang go rims kyang 'di ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa brgyad kho na dang go rims kyang 'di ltar gsungs she na /
translated: Why are there just eight aspects and why is the order of the aspects as it is?

original: 'dir bshad pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po yin la snying po yang gzhan yan lag thams cad las dam pa gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po yin la snying po yang gzhan yan lag thams cad las dam pa gtso bo yin no //
translated: Here, this is the explanation: the essence of the perfection of wisdom is the essence, which is the most excellent and foremost of all the branches.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtso bo'i don ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par @275b thar pa'i sgo gsum yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtso bo'i don ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par @275b thar pa'i sgo gsum yin no //
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is the three doors of liberation, beginning with emptiness.

original: de ni rnam pa brgyad po de dag gis bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa brgyad po de dag gis bsdus pa yin la /
translated: That is included in these eight aspects.

original: rnam pa de dag nyid 'dir go rims yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag nyid 'dir go rims yin te /
translated: Those very aspects are the order here.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa gnyis kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa gnyis kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, the meditative stabilization of emptiness is due to the two, emptiness and signlessness.

original: bar ma bzhis ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bzhi bkag pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: bar ma bzhis ni skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba bzhi bkag pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The four middling ones are the concentration of signlessness, because they block the four: birth, cessation, defilement, and purification.

original: tha ma gnyis kyis ni smon pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /🔽'di ltar skyon spangs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: tha ma gnyis kyis ni smon pa'i ting nge 'dzin te / 'di ltar skyon spangs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The last two are the concentration of wishlessness,

original: yon tan thob par bya ba'i ched du smon par byed la de gnyi ga bkag pas smon pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thob par bya ba'i ched du smon par byed la de gnyi ga bkag pas smon pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: because one wishes for the elimination of faults or the attainment of good qualities, and both of these are blocked by the last two concentrations.

original: da ni bstan pa'i rnam pas rnam par bltas pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bstan pa'i rnam pas rnam par bltas pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the result of the view through the aspects of the teaching,

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Therefore, at that time, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i rnam pas rnam par lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i rnam pas rnam par lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means through the view by the aspects of the teaching.

original: de'i tshe ni de'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time means at that occasion.

original: stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba la gzugs yang dag par rjes su bltar med ces 'byung bar sbyar te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba la gzugs yang dag par rjes su bltar med ces 'byung bar sbyar te /
translated: The passage, One sees emptiness, but does not see form, etc., is to be supplied.

original: chos thams cad mi mthong ba nyid ni stong pa nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi mthong ba nyid ni stong pa nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: The non-seeing of all dharmas is the seeing of emptiness.

original: gzugs med ces 'byung ba la sogs pa ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams dgag pa 'di dag ston to /
analyzed: gzugs med ces 'byung ba la sogs pa ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams dgag pa 'di dag ston to /
translated: The statement “form does not exist” and so on teaches the negation of the aggregates, sense bases, and elements.

original: de la gzugs med ces 'byung ba nas tha ma rnam par shes pa med ces 'byung ba'i bar gyis ni phung po 'gog pa'o ;
analyzed: de la gzugs med ces 'byung ba nas tha ma rnam par shes pa med ces 'byung ba'i bar gyis ni phung po 'gog pa'o ;
translated: Among these, the statement “form does not exist” up to “consciousness does not exist” negates the aggregates.

original: / mig med ces 'byung ba nas brtsams te chos med ces 'byung ba 'dis ni skye mched 'gog go //
analyzed: / mig med ces 'byung ba nas brtsams te chos med ces 'byung ba 'dis ni skye mched 'gog go //
translated: The statement “the eye does not exist” up to “the dharmas do not exist” negates the sense bases.

original: mig gi khams med pa nas bar gyi sgras gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa bco lnga shugs kyis ston to //
analyzed: mig gi khams med pa nas bar gyi sgras gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa bco lnga shugs kyis ston to //
translated: The statement “the eye element does not exist” and so on implicitly teaches the fifteen elements, up to the form element and the eye consciousness element.

original: tha ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
analyzed: tha ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te /
translated: The final two elements are the mind element and the mind consciousness element.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa la sogs pa la yang gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa la sogs pa la yang gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, all should be applied to that which lacks a defining characteristic, that which is unarisen, that which is unceasing, and so on.

original: ci ste stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa la phung po dang khams dang skye mched mi srid na /
analyzed: ci ste stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa la phung po dang khams dang skye mched mi srid na /
translated: If the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are not possible in emptiness, signlessness, and so on,

original: 'o na ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba dang / ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: then how can it be posited that due to the condition of ignorance, formations arise, and due to the cessation of ignorance, formations cease?

original: de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin las skye ba dang rkyen 'gags pas kyang 'gog go zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag bcu gnyis rang gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin las skye ba dang rkyen 'gags pas kyang 'gog go zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Similarly, how can it be posited that the twelve links arise from their own conditions as they are, and due to the cessation of the conditions, they also cease?

original: bden te / @276a * //
analyzed: bden te / @276a * //
translated: That is true,

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid yin gyi /🔽stong pa nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir /🔽ma rig pa med /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid yin gyi / stong pa nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir / ma rig pa med /
translated: but it is only conventionally existent.🔽It is not in emptiness, signlessness, and so on.🔽Therefore it is said, “There is no ignorance,

original: ma rig pa zad pa med ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa zad pa med ces gsungs so //
translated: and there is no exhaustion of ignorance.”

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras 'du byed la sogs pa shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras 'du byed la sogs pa shugs kyis bstan to //
translated: The word “in the middle” indicates the formative forces and so on by implication.

original: rga shi med do //
analyzed: rga shi med do //
translated: There is no aging and death.

original: de med pas zad pa med do //
analyzed: de med pas zad pa med do //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no cessation.

original: ci ste don dam par srid pa'i yan lag dang / de zad pa med na 'o na ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa nyid du mthong /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par srid pa'i yan lag dang / de zad pa med na 'o na ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa nyid du mthong /
translated: If the members of existence and their cessation do not exist ultimately, then how is it that the noble ones see the truth of suffering and so on?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang bden pa nyid du mthong ba de ni log pa nyid du 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang bden pa nyid du mthong ba de ni log pa nyid du 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: That which the noble ones see as truth is not suitable to be false.

original: de dag bden pa nyid yin na ni ji ltar srid pa'i yan lag dang de zad pa med ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag bden pa nyid yin na ni ji ltar srid pa'i yan lag dang de zad pa med ba yin zhe na /
translated: If they are truth, then how can the members of existence and their cessation not exist?

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in regard to emptiness and so on, which is their own nature,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “suffering” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa de'i tshe de'i rgyu kun 'byung ba yang ga la yod de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa de'i tshe de'i rgyu kun 'byung ba yang ga la yod de /
translated: When the nature of suffering does not exist because it is unarisen, then how can its cause, the origin, exist?

original: de bas na de 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang / de 'gog pa'i thabs su 'gyur ba lam yang ci yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na de 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang / de 'gog pa'i thabs su 'gyur ba lam yang ci yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing whatsoever that is called “cessation” and there is also no path that would be a means to that cessation.

original: mtshan ma'i bdag nyid kyi skyon spangs pa'i phyir ye shes kyang rang gi ngo bo don dam par grub pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i bdag nyid kyi skyon spangs pa'i phyir ye shes kyang rang gi ngo bo don dam par grub pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, because of the elimination of the error of the identity of signs, wisdom also does not exist ultimately in terms of its own entity,

original: ye shes med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Wisdom does not exist.”

original: yi ge kha cig las mi shes pa med do zhes kyang 'byung ste de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las mi shes pa med do zhes kyang 'byung ste de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Some texts read, “Ignorance does not exist.” The meaning of that is as follows.

original: gal te stong pa nyid la mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes med na /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid la mtshan ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ye shes med na /
translated: If, because of being empty, wisdom does not exist due to being free from the error of the afflictions of signs,

original: 'o na mi shes pa rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid yod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mi shes pa rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid yod do snyam na /
translated: then it might be thought that ignorance, which is characterized by delusion, exists.

original: mi shes pa med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi shes pa med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Ignorance does not exist.”

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la mi shes pa 'di ga la srid /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid la mi shes pa 'di ga la srid /
translated: How could ignorance be possible in the emptiness that is its own entity?

original: de bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / de thob par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo med na thob pa zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / de thob par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo med na thob pa zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, if the qualities such as the analytical knowledges, the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc., and the attainment of those do not exist in their own nature, it is not tenable to speak of “attainment.”

original: thob pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: thob pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “There is no attainment.”

original: de ltar thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag nas de las bzlog pa ma thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ma thob pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa bkag nas de las bzlog pa ma thob pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ma thob pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, having refuted the concept of attainment, in order to refute the concept of non-attainment, which is the opposite of that, it is said, “There is no non-attainment.”

original: 'di ni ye shes dang mi shes pa dang / thob pa dang ma thob pa las 'das ba sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i don zab mo bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes dang mi shes pa dang / thob pa dang ma thob pa las 'das ba sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i don zab mo bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as teaching the profound meaning, which is beyond consciousness and unconsciousness, attainment and non-attainment, and is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de ltar na gong du bstan pa'i rnam pas 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @276b chos gang yang thob pa med pa de'i phyir byang chub kyi ched du sems pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid sgom pa'i lam dang rab tu ldan pa la rten cing shin tu brten nas brtson 'grus khyad par can gyis zhugs shing gnas te'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gong du bstan pa'i rnam pas 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @276b chos gang yang thob pa med pa de'i phyir byang chub kyi ched du sems pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid sgom pa'i lam dang rab tu ldan pa la rten cing shin tu brten nas brtson 'grus khyad par can gyis zhugs shing gnas te'o //
translated: Thus, in the manner taught above, since no dharma is attained in the perfection of wisdom, therefore, the thought for awakening, the special attachment, and whatever intention there is, in dependence on the path of meditation endowed with the characteristics of the perfection of wisdom as taught, one should enter and abide with special effort.

original: byang chub la chos gang yang yongs su grub pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub la chos gang yang yongs su grub pa med do //
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever that is fully established in awakening.

original: de skad du zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de skad du zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Candrapradīpa Samādhi and so forth,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa /🔽shin tu phra ba'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa / shin tu phra ba'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
translated: the Bhagavān taught the essence of awakening:🔽Even the most subtle dharma does not exist.

original: shin tu phra zhes bya ba'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: shin tu phra zhes bya ba'ang yod pa min //
translated: Even the most subtle is not existent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las kyang /
translated: And the Tantra of the Great River of the Awareness of Vairocana states:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de na shin tu phra ba'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med de /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de na shin tu phra ba'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med de /
translated: Lord of Secrets, there is no very subtle phenomenon there, nor is it apprehended.

original: de na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: There, it is called unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: ci ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la chos 'ga' yang med na skyon gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos bsal nas ye shes su gyur pa yang gang yang med /
analyzed: ci ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la chos 'ga' yang med na skyon gyi mtshan nyid kyi chos bsal nas ye shes su gyur pa yang gang yang med /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom and unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment have no phenomena at all, then, having eliminated the phenomena of the characteristics of faults, there is also no wisdom.

original: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid 'dod pa thob pa yang med ce na ci'i phyir byang chub las brtsams te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gnas pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid 'dod pa thob pa yang med ce na ci'i phyir byang chub las brtsams te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gnas pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: And if there is no attainment of the desired characteristics of good qualities, then why, beginning with enlightenment, does this one who abides in dependence on the perfection of wisdom think in this way?

original: ji tsam du kha cig gi re ba sngon du btang ba ni 'ga' zhig la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: ji tsam du kha cig gi re ba sngon du btang ba ni 'ga' zhig la 'jug par byed de /
translated: To the extent that one has previously generated hope, one engages in the perfections.

original: de thams cad ni mi 'dod pa'i skyon spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug go //
analyzed: de thams cad ni mi 'dod pa'i skyon spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug go //
translated: All of that is for the sake of eliminating the faults of not wanting and for the sake of attaining the virtues of wanting.

original: gang du yang rang gi ngo bo stong pa yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi dmigs na de la su zhig 'jug /
analyzed: gang du yang rang gi ngo bo stong pa yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi dmigs na de la su zhig 'jug /
translated: But when one does not observe any dharma at all because of the emptiness of its own-being, then who engages in what?

original: ci'i phyir 'jug /'jug pa'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug /'jug pa'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
translated: Why does one engage? What is the result of engagement?

original: sems kyi sgrib pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyi sgrib pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text states: “because of the non-obstruction of mind, etc.”

original: yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la gags byed pa'i phyir sems la sgrib par byed kun nas khebs par byed pa'i phyir sems kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa la gags byed pa'i phyir sems la sgrib par byed kun nas khebs par byed pa'i phyir sems kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obstruction of mind is so called because it obstructs, because it covers over, the mind’s thorough knowledge of the meaning of reality just as it is.

original: de dag kyang gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa shin tu rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa shin tu rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig go //
translated: Moreover, they are the twenty two extremely confused states such as the manifest clinging to persons and phenomena and the eleven resistances to the negative tendencies.

original: gang dag spang pa'i phyir 'joms pa'i don gyi gnyen po ni go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: gang dag spang pa'i phyir 'joms pa'i don gyi gnyen po ni go rims bzhin du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The eleven grounds such as the Very Joyous are the antidotes that eliminate those states to be abandoned.

original: sa @277a * //🔽la 'jug pa las ji skad du //🔽yan lag bcu gcig rdzogs pa yis //
analyzed: sa @277a * // la 'jug pa las ji skad du // yan lag bcu gcig rdzogs pa yis //
translated: The Ten Grounds states:🔽The eleven grounds such as the Very Joyous

original: rab dga' la sogs bcu gcig sa //
analyzed: rab dga' la sogs bcu gcig sa //
translated: are complete with eleven aspects.

original: rmongs gnyis gnas ngan len gcig ste //
analyzed: rmongs gnyis gnas ngan len gcig ste //
translated: The two confusions and one negative tendency

original: mi mthun phyogs ni tha dad do //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs ni tha dad do //
translated: are the different opposing factors.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang ;
translated: And the Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra says:

original: de la sa dang po la gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de la sa dang po la gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the first stage, there is the extreme delusion of manifest clinging to persons and things, the extreme delusion of afflictions leading to miserable realms, and the unfavorable side of the negative tendencies for those.

original: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the second stage, there is the extreme delusion of error in subtle downfalls, the extreme delusion of the various kinds of destinies of karma, and the unfavorable side of the negative tendencies for those.

original: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi shin tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi shin tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun ba'i phyogs so //
translated: On the third stage, there is the extreme delusion of attachment to the desire realm, the extreme delusion of not perfecting the retention of what one has heard, and the unfavorable side of the negative tendencies for those.

original: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the fourth stage, there is the extreme delusion of craving meditative absorption, the extreme delusion of craving the Dharma, and the unfavorable side of the negative tendencies for those.

original: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba las shin tu phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang /🔽de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba las shin tu phyir phyogs pa dang mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa yid la byed pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the fifth, the error of attention directed to what is extremely averse to or inclined toward cyclic existence, and the error of attention directed to what is extremely averse to or inclined toward nirvana.

original: drug pa la ni 'du byed 'byung ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang du 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: drug pa la ni 'du byed 'byung ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang du 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the sixth, the error of the manifest occurrence of formations, the error of the occurrence of many signs, and the resistance to the elimination of their negative tendencies.

original: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i thabs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo 'byung ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i thabs la shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the seventh, the error of the occurrence of subtle signs, the error of the method of attention directed to the complete absence of signs, and the resistance to the elimination of their negative tendencies.

original: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la bsgrim pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dag la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la bsgrim pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dag la dbang ba'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the eighth, the stupidity of being concentrated on the signless and the stupidity of mastery over signs and their negative reflex actions.

original: dgu pa la ni chos bstan pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa la gzungs kyi dbang gi shin tu rmongs pa dang / @277b spobs pa la dbang gi shin tu rmongs pa dang /🔽de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni chos bstan pa tshad med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa la gzungs kyi dbang gi shin tu rmongs pa dang / @277b spobs pa la dbang gi shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the ninth, the stupidity of the mastery of retention over the boundless teaching of the Dharma, the boundless words and letters of the Dharma, and the wisdom and eloquence from the higher to the higher, the stupidity of mastery over eloquence, and their negative reflex actions.

original: bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba phra mo la 'jug pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the tenth, the stupidity of the great superknowledges, the stupidity of entering into the subtle secrets, and their negative reflex actions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu phra ba'i chags pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / thogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu phra ba'i chags pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / thogs pa'i shin tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: At the stage of Buddhahood, the extremely confused ignorance about the most subtle attachment to all objects of knowledge, the extremely confused ignorance about obstruction, and the negative reflex that is their basis are eliminated.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa la 'jigs pa med de mi skrag go //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa la 'jigs pa med de mi skrag go //
translated: Because they do not exist, the one who stands in the perfection of wisdom is fearless, not terrified.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gzhan du gnas pa la ni phyin ci log las 'jigs pa yin no zhes bstan to //

original: grol ba po ni med kyang brtson //
analyzed: grol ba po ni med kyang brtson //

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //

original: phyin ci log med pa ni 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: phyin ci log med pa ni 'jug pa med de /

original: sa bcu pa las de skad du sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na rmi lam na chus khyer ba rmis pa'i skyes bu sad pa'i tshe chu las thar bar bya ba'i 'bad pa chen po log pa'i dpe dang de nyid de'i
analyzed: sa bcu pa las de skad du sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa na rmi lam na chus khyer ba rmis pa'i skyes bu sad pa'i tshe chu las thar bar bya ba'i 'bad pa chen po log pa'i dpe dang de nyid de'i

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te //

original: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni phyin ci log rang gi rmongs pa ji lta ba las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni phyin ci log rang gi rmongs pa ji lta ba las 'das pa ste /
translated: Here, one who abides in the perfection of wisdom has transcended the delusion of error just as it is.

original: shin tu song ba ni phyin ci log las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu song ba ni phyin ci log las 'das pa'o //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the cessation of conceptuality.

original: mthar phyin pa ni mthar thug pa las te /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni mthar thug pa las te /
translated: Having reached the end is to have reached the ultimate.

original: ji skad du sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du sa bcu pa las /
translated: As the Ten Grounds says:

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin pa yin te de'i gong nas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //

translated: Because it is the end of purification, since it is the abandonment of the discriminations to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, since there are no other discriminations to be abandoned above it.

analyzed: mthar phyin pas sam sems mthar phyin pa'i bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das pa 'di yin pas de la de skad ces gsungs so //

original: chub sems dpa' rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams 'jug go //

analyzed: spong ba che ba nyid 'dis ni de'i ched du 'jug pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin te /
translated: This great abandonment shows the cause of entry into it,

original: de'i ched du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ched du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since one enters it for that reason.

original: dus gsum du zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid dang rtogs pa che ba nyid gnyis kyi ched du bstan to //
analyzed: dus gsum du zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa sems che ba nyid dang rtogs pa che ba nyid gnyis kyi ched du bstan to //
translated: The phrase in the three times and so on teaches the greatness of mind and the greatness of realization for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: The three times are the past, the future, and the present.

original: de dag na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de /
analyzed: de dag na rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de /
translated: All the buddhas dwell in those times.

original: blo khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: blo khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
translated: They are buddhas because they have special intelligence.

original: de thams cad kyang yin la sangs rgyas kyang yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad do //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang yin la sangs rgyas kyang yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad do //
translated: They are all buddhas because they are all buddhas.

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Abhisamayālaṅkāra says:

original: sa bcu dag ni rab bsgrubs nas //
analyzed: sa bcu dag ni rab bsgrubs nas //
translated: Having accomplished the ten stages,

original: dbang gi rnam pa thob pa yin //
analyzed: dbang gi rnam pa thob pa yin //
translated: they attain the form of empowerment.

original: stong pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos //
analyzed: stong pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos //
translated: The empty phenomena that are like illusions

original: gang gis 'dir ni kun mkhyen cing //
analyzed: gang gis 'dir ni kun mkhyen cing //
translated: are known here by the omniscient one.

original: sems can kun gyi rnam mkhyen pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi rnam mkhyen pa //
translated: The one who knows the minds of all sentient beings

original: sangs rgyas zhes ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes ni brjod pa yin //
translated: is called a buddha.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba bden pa'i bdag nyid la yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba bden pa'i bdag nyid la yin te /
translated: The phrase “in the perfection of wisdom” refers to the source of the transcendent wisdom of the tathagatas, which is the nature of truth.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces brjod pa gang yin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces brjod pa gang yin pa la bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as referring to the state of omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhes 'byung ba ni 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las dus snga ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhes 'byung ba ni 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las dus snga ma'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in dependence on the perfection of wisdom” means that it is prior to the state of complete enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: This state of omniscience should be regarded as the uninterrupted meditative absorption.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa dang / de'i man ngag mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las ji skad du /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa dang / de'i man ngag mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines and its instructions, the Ornament of Clear Realization:

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob bar chad med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob bar chad med //
translated: The attainment of buddhahood is uninterrupted.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting 'dzin te //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting 'dzin te //
translated: It is the uninterrupted meditative absorption.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin //
translated: It is omniscience.

original: de yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: de yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its object is non-existence.

original: dran pa yang ni bdag por 'dod //
analyzed: dran pa yang ni bdag por 'dod //
translated: Mindfulness is considered its ruler.

original: rnam pa 'di ni bzhi pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni bzhi pa nyid //
translated: This is the fourth aspect.

original: mtshan nyid med pa mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa mtshan nyid yin //
translated: The characteristic of the absence of characteristics.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bla na med pa zhes 'byung ba ni thob pa dang dmigs pa dang sgrub pa rnam pa 'di las gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes 'byung ba ni thob pa dang dmigs pa dang sgrub pa rnam pa 'di las gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “unsurpassed” means that there is nothing higher than this in terms of attainment, object, and practice.

original: yang dag par zhes 'byung ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes 'byung ba ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: The phrase “perfect enlightenment” means non-erroneously.

original: mnyam par zhes 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par zhes 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “equal enlightenment” means that there is only one characteristic because of the absence of characteristics.

original: byang chub ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is realization.

original: mngon par ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mngon par ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The prefix abhi means directly.

original: mnyam par sangs rgyas pa ni rdzogs par sangs rgyas @278b so ;
analyzed: mnyam par sangs rgyas pa ni rdzogs par sangs rgyas @278b so ;
translated: Equal enlightenment is perfect enlightenment.

original: / de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las /
analyzed: / de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what is unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, just as is the thusness of all dharmas, so also is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub lags /
translated: Lord, how is the thusness of all dharmas unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Subhūti, just as is the thusness of form, etc., up to the thusness of nirvana, so also is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de la bla na med pa'i tshig gis ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas sems che ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la bla na med pa'i tshig gis ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas sems che ba nyid yin no //
translated: There, the word unsurpassed indicates the greatness of mind, since it is the best of all sentient beings.

original: de'i lhag ma ni rtogs pa che ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i lhag ma ni rtogs pa che ba nyid yin no //
translated: The rest indicates the greatness of realization.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na thugs la bzhag ste chen po nyid rnam pa de gsum gyi ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pas gsum gyi ched du zhes brjod do //

translated: In the past, when he was a bodhisattva, he took to heart the three aspects of the great, and he entered into the perfection of wisdom for the sake of those three, and so it is said for the sake of the three.

original: rdzogs pa'i tshe na ni snga mas 'bras bu spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyi ma gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i tshe na ni snga mas 'bras bu spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyi ma gnyis kyis ni 'bras bu rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: At the time of completion, the former [perfection of wisdom] teaches the perfection of the abandonment of the result, and the latter two teach the perfection of the realization of the result.

original: ji ltar yul ljongs 'ga'i ched du rgyal pos mchod sbyin byed pa dang / tha mar yul ljongs thob pa 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar yul ljongs 'ga'i ched du rgyal pos mchod sbyin byed pa dang / tha mar yul ljongs thob pa 'bras bu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a king performs a sacrifice for the sake of some land, and in the end the attainment of the land is the result,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas phyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir dang rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas phyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir dang rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, based on the perfection of wisdom, one becomes free from error and attains realization.🔽In order to show that the perfection of wisdom itself is the mantra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gsang sngags so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gsang sngags so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, Sariputra, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni bstan zin to //
translated: The characteristic of the perfection of wisdom has been taught.

original: gsang sngags ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skyob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / skyob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a mantra, because it is knowledge, and because it is a protector.

analyzed: don gnyis po de gnyis tshig phyi ma rnams kyis gsal bar byed do//
translated: These two meanings are clarified by the following verses.

analyzed: chen po ni khyab pa dang ldan ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su bstan pa yin //

original: gang gi tshad ni 'ga' yang med //

analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa 'dis ni khyab pa dang / thogs pa med pa dang / rgyun ma chad pa la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: By this equality with space, one should see the pervasion, the non-obstruction, the uninterrupted continuity, and so forth.

original: de dag gis ni shes pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes pa'i don bstan to //
translated: By these, the meaning of knowledge is taught.

analyzed: skyob pa'i @279b don bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of protection,

analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: 'du byed dang 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed de rgyun gcod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i gsang sngags so //
analyzed: 'du byed dang 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed de rgyun gcod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i gsang sngags so //
translated: The mantra that completely pacifies all suffering, which completely pacifies all suffering characterized by formations, change, and the suffering of suffering, and so forth, is the mantra that completely pacifies all suffering.

original: de ltar gsang sngags kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don bstan nas gsang ste brjod par bya ba nyid kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gsang sngags kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don bstan nas gsang ste brjod par bya ba nyid kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the meaning of the etymology of mantra, in order to teach the meaning of the etymology of secret mantra,

original: bden te ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bden te ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “because of truth, because of non-reversal,” and so on.

original: bden pa ni de kho na nyid de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ni de kho na nyid de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyin ci ma logs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gang yin pa de ni phyin ci ma logs pa nyid do //
translated: That which is the way things really are is non-reversal.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags su rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags su rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the perfection of wisdom is a mantra.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: dbang po rtul po'i gang zag gang rnam pa bstan pas rnam par lta bar mi nus pa la gsang ste bstan pa bzhin de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po'i gang zag gang rnam pa bstan pas rnam par lta bar mi nus pa la gsang ste bstan pa bzhin de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gsang sngags ji lta ba bzhin du gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: For those individuals of dull faculties who are unable to view through the teachings, the secret should be taught. By them, the perfection of wisdom should be held as a mantra, just as it is.

original: gsang sngags ni gsang ste bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig ni 'di skad kyi dbyings la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags ni gsang ste bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig ni 'di skad kyi dbyings la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: The mantra is secret, and it is to be explained. The etymology is this: it is to be relied upon in the realm of the words.

original: yang na yid la gnas pa ni skyob par byed pa yin pas na gsang sngags so //
analyzed: yang na yid la gnas pa ni skyob par byed pa yin pas na gsang sngags so //
translated: Or else, it is a mantra because it protects by abiding in the mind.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gus pas rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gus pas rgyun mi 'chad par yid la bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom, which is to be kept in mind respectfully and uninterruptedly.

original: rigs pas 'thad pa'i phyir rigs pa yin pas shes par bya ba ni nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pas 'thad pa'i phyir rigs pa yin pas shes par bya ba ni nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood as ascertained because it is reasonable, since it is reasonable.

original: de ltar zhes 'byung ba ni gsungs pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes 'byung ba ni gsungs pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus is the teaching, which is to be trained in by the method of the teaching that has been given.

original: de nas zhes 'byung ba ni skabs 'dir bar mchad par ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes 'byung ba ni skabs 'dir bar mchad par ro //
translated: Then is the occasion, which is in the middle of this section.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las 'byung ba ni sngar bstan pa las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las 'byung ba ni sngar bstan pa las so //
translated: Arising from that meditative absorption is from the previously taught.

original: bzhengs nas zhes 'byung ba ni sems kyis btang nas so //
analyzed: bzhengs nas zhes 'byung ba ni sems kyis btang nas so //
translated: Rising is letting go of the mind.

original: ston pa po la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa dang bshad pa la yang rjes su mthun pa byed de /
analyzed: ston pa po la legs so zhes bya ba byin pa dang bshad pa la yang rjes su mthun pa byed de /
translated: He gives the word good to the teacher and also agrees with the explanation.

original: legs so zhes bya ba byin pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba byin pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The nature of giving the word good is as follows: Good, good, son of noble family!

original: de la lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni dga' ba'i don nam dga' ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni dga' ba'i don nam dga' ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the repetition twice is for the purpose of delight or great joy.

original: de de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas ni bshad pa la rjes su mthun par byed do //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba la sogs pas ni bshad pa la rjes su mthun par byed do //
translated: By it is so and so forth, he agrees with the explanation.

original: de de bzhin yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is so, not otherwise.

original: @280a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @280a * // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, One should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of training?

original: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa de bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa de bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, Just as you have taught.

original: khyod kyis bstan pa las mi 'gal bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan pa las mi 'gal bar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means one should train without contradicting your teaching.

analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bstan pa la rang gi rjes su mthun pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the Lord, having taught in accordance with the teaching of the noble Avalokitesvara,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang 'di khyod kyis bstan pa gang yin pa de la mngon par dgyes so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that the other Tathagatas also rejoice in this teaching,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: he said, The Tathagatas also rejoice.

analyzed: rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa'i don la nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: The word rejoice means to be certain about what must be done.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bshad pa 'di 'dra ba la rjes su dgyes pa gdon mi za bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bshad pa 'di 'dra ba la rjes su dgyes pa gdon mi za bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Tathagatas certainly rejoice in this teaching.

analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang rjes su dgyes pa 'di gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'di bshad pa la mngon par dgyes par 'os pa yang bstan to //
translated: By these two, in accordance with and rejoicing in, it is also taught that this Tathagata is worthy of this teaching.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus,
