analyzed: de skad ces 'byung ba ni sh'a ri'i bus dris pa nas brtsams te /
translated: this is what is said, beginning with the question of Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the Tathāgatas rejoicing.

original: bka' stsal nas zhes 'byung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas so //
analyzed: bka' stsal nas zhes 'byung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal nas so //
translated: Having spoken thus,

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'dir 'chad par mdzad pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi bka' yin te /
translated: it is explained here by the noble Avalokiteśvara, but it is the word of the Tathāgata himself.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata blessed it.

analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas gang 'chad par byed pa de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yin na /
translated: Whatever is explained by śrāvakas and others, all that is the word of the Tathāgata.

translated: What need is there to mention the explanation by the noble Avalokiteśvara, Samantabhadra, Mañjuśrī, and so on, who have entered into Buddhahood itself?

original: 'di'i don ni bdag gis sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni bdag gis sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has been taught by me previously.

original: yi rangs te zhes 'byung ba ni stong phrag brgya pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don las gtso bo nyid kyi dam par gyur pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i don bye brag tu ji ltar rigs bar thos pa dang / bshad pa gang gis yi rang ba dang dga' ba la de skad @280b ces bya'o //

translated: The phrase rejoiced means that, from among the topics to be expressed in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the meaning of the heart of the perfection of wisdom, which is the most excellent of the most excellent, was heard and explained in whatever way is appropriate, and by whatever means one rejoices and delights, that is what is meant by this phrase.

original: de yang sh'a ri'i bu dang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang sh'a ri'i bu dang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, this refers to Śāriputra, the noble Avalokiteśvara, and so on.

original: kha cig gis bcom ldan 'das la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: kha cig gis bcom ldan 'das la yang sbyar te /
translated: Some connect this to the Blessed One as well.

original: de'i tshe ni gdul bya rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don gyi gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du bzung ba ni dgyes pa'i rgyur blta bar bya'o //

translated: At that time, the disciples should consider that the correct understanding of the principal meaning of the perfections is a cause of delight.

original: thams cad bsdu pa'i phyir dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: thams cad bsdu pa'i phyir dang zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase because of the inclusion of all is stated.

analyzed: 'dis ni yi rang ba dang mngon par bstod pa yang bsdu bar bya'o //

original: lha ni rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The gods are those of the four heavenly realms and so on.

analyzed: de yang sbyin byed ma'i bu dang / sbyin ldan ma'i bu rnams yin no //
translated: The demigods are those who arose from the churning of the milk ocean, such as the sons of Dattātreya and the sons of Yajñadatta.

analyzed: dri za ni lha'i glu len pa ste yul 'khor srung la sogs pa'o //
translated: The gandharvas are the heavenly singers, such as Dhṛtarāṣṭra and so on.

original: lha gtso bo yin pa'i phyir thog mar smos so //
analyzed: lha gtso bo yin pa'i phyir thog mar smos so //
translated: Gods are mentioned first because they are the most important.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is destroyed because it is destroyed.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: It is the five aggregates.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni bshad pa rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni bshad pa rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The Blessed One's teaching is the explanation, the essence of which is the perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par bstod pa ni mngon par dga' ba dang ldan zhing dga' ba dang ldan pas bzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽shes rab pha rol phyin pa yi //

translated: The praise is the joy and delight with which it is received.🔽Whatever merit I have gained

analyzed: snying po rnam phye'i bsod nams gang //
translated: by explaining the essence of the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdag gis thob des 'jig rten rnams //
analyzed: bdag gis thob des 'jig rten rnams //
translated: may all beings by that merit

analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin bdag shog / tshangs pa'i 'byung gnas gtsug lag khang gnas pa'i //
translated: attain the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun rnams kyi zhal ngor ni //
translated: In the presence of the community of monks🔽dwelling in the temple of Brahma's abode,

analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i snying po yi //
translated: I have explained the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

translated: The extensive explanation was composed by Vimalamitra.🔽The extensive explanation of the noble Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom composed by the Indian master Vimalamitra is complete.
